user.title: Micro Weather Station Setup
user.description:
Connect your weather sensors to create an intelligent weather entity.

**Required:** Only outdoor temperature is required.

**Setup Process:**
â€¢ **Atmospheric Sensors** - Temperature, humidity, pressure, and altitude
â€¢ **Wind Sensors** - Wind speed, direction, and gust measurements
â€¢ **Rain Sensors** - Precipitation detection and intensity
â€¢ **Solar Sensors** - Sun, radiation, and light measurements
â€¢ **Final Settings** - Update interval configuration

**How Each Sensor Is Used:**

ğŸŒ¡ï¸ **Dewpoint Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Direct dewpoint measurement for maximum accuracy
â€¢ Used in fog detection algorithm (>98% humidity + dewpoint)
â€¢ Improves comfort index calculations
â€¢ Fallback: Calculated from temperature + humidity if not available

ğŸ’§ **Humidity Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Essential for fog detection (triggers at >98% humidity)
â€¢ Used in comfort index and heat index calculations
â€¢ Helps determine precipitation probability
â€¢ Combined with solar radiation for cloud cover analysis

ğŸ“Š **Pressure Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Core component for weather forecasting (5-day and hourly)
â€¢ Storm detection (rapid pressure drops indicate storms)
â€¢ Trend analysis for weather pattern prediction
â€¢ Used to calculate weather stability and change probability

ğŸ”ï¸ **Altitude** (optional)
â€¢ Station elevation above sea level
â€¢ Adjusts atmospheric pressure calculations for your location
â€¢ Improves forecast accuracy, especially for pressure-based predictions
â€¢ Higher altitudes = lower expected pressure readings

ğŸ’¨ **Wind Speed Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Determines wind conditions in weather state
â€¢ Storm detection (>25 km/h + rain = stormy conditions)
â€¢ Wind chill calculations for apparent temperature
â€¢ Severe weather alerts and wind-related forecasting

ğŸ§­ **Wind Direction Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Provides wind bearing data for detailed weather reports
â€¢ Used in storm tracking and weather pattern analysis
â€¢ Enhances forecast accuracy with directional wind data

ğŸŒªï¸ **Wind Gust Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Severe weather detection and storm intensity measurement
â€¢ Safety alerts for dangerous wind conditions
â€¢ Enhanced storm classification (gusty vs steady winds)

ğŸŒ§ï¸ **Rain Rate Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Direct precipitation intensity measurement
â€¢ Triggers rainy/stormy weather conditions
â€¢ Used for precipitation forecasting
â€¢ Overrides other conditions when rain detected

ğŸŒ¦ï¸ **Rain State Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Boolean rain detection (dry/wet states)
â€¢ Immediate weather condition override when wet
â€¢ Backup precipitation detection if rate sensor unavailable

â˜€ï¸ **Solar Radiation Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Primary cloud cover detection (>400 W/mÂ² = sunny, <100 = cloudy)
â€¢ Day/night classification and solar intensity
â€¢ Used in fog detection (low radiation + high humidity)
â€¢ Overrides other conditions for clear sky detection

ğŸ’¡ **Solar Lux Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Light-based day/night detection
â€¢ Backup cloud cover detection if radiation sensor unavailable
â€¢ Visibility calculations and twilight detection

ğŸ›¡ï¸ **UV Index Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Clear sky confirmation (high UV = definitely sunny)
â€¢ Sun intensity measurement for safety recommendations
â€¢ Enhanced sunny weather detection accuracy

â˜€ï¸ **Sun Sensor** (optional)
â€¢ Solar elevation data for accurate cloud cover calculations
â€¢ Improves weather detection by accounting for sun position
â€¢ Higher elevation = more expected solar radiation
â€¢ Fallback: 45Â° elevation if not configured

**Configuration Tips:**
â€¢ Use Developer Tools â†’ States to find sensor entity IDs
â€¢ Temperature sensors should have device_class='temperature'
â€¢ Pressure sensors should use relative/barometric pressure
â€¢ Update interval: 1-60 minutes (how often to refresh weather data)
â€¢ More sensors = more accurate weather detection!

final.title: Final Configuration
final.description:

â€¢ How often the weather data is refreshed and sensors are polled

â€¢ Lower values provide more responsive updates but may increase system load
